intro: Fimbristylis eligulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spikerush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flower heads. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist soils. Fimbristylis eligulata plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
